creator: MikeDawg@gmail.com
text:
I am receiving the following error trying to 'make' on Apache 2.0.55:

-- BEGIN ERROR

/usr/build-1/libtool --silent --mode=compile gcc  -g -O2 -pthread    -DLINUX=2
-D_REENTRANT -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE
-DAP_HAVE_DESIGNATED_INITIALIZER   -I/usr/include/apr-1 -I/usr/include/apache
-I. -I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/os/unix -I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/server/mpm/prefork
-I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/modules/http -I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/modules/filters
-I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/modules/proxy -I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/include
-I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/modules/generators -I/usr/include/openssl
-I/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/modules/dav/main -prefer-non-pic -static -c config.c &&
touch config.lo
config.c: In function `ap_process_resource_config':
config.c:1603: error: `FNM_PERIOD' undeclared (first use in this function)
config.c:1603: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once
config.c:1603: error: for each function it appears in.)
make[2]: *** [config.lo] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/server'
make[1]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/httpd-2.0.55/server'
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1

---- END ERROR

I ran configure with the following options:

----- BEGIN CONFIGURE

./configure --enable-layout=Slackware --enable-access --enable-auth
--enable-echo --enable-case-filter-in --enable-case-filter --enable-deflate
--enable-mime-magic --enable-headers --enable-unique-id --enable-setenvif
--enable-usertrack --enable-ssl --enable-http --enable-autoindex --enable-info
--enable-suexec --enable-cgi --enable-vhost-alias --enable-dir --enable-speling
--enable-actions --enable-negotiation --enable-userdir --enable-alias
--enable-rewrite --enable-so --with-apr=/usr/bin/apr-1-config --with-port=80
--with-suexec-uidmin=500 --with-suexec-gidmin=100 --with-suexec-umask=0022
--with-apr-util=/usr/bin



------ END CONFIGURE

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text:
I think that either your

- apr/ apr-util installation is broken or
- not installed in the locations you specified.

--with-apr=/usr/bin/apr-1-config 
--with-apr-util=/usr/bin

seem to be very weird locations. Please try to compile either

- with the bundled apr/ apr-util or
- fix your apr/ apr-util installation locations.

I don't understand why /usr/bin/ is a weird location for apr-config
(apr-1-config, binary file).  The distribution's default install location of
that binary is in /usr/bin.  Previous to configure/making apache, I had built
apr-1.2.2 and apr-util-1.2.2 and specified /usr/bin as the bindir.  --with-apr
configure option allows you to put in the location to the apr-config file.
creator: MikeDawg@gmail.com
rpluem@apache.org
text:
Are you sure that you have a readable version of apr_fnmatch.h in
/usr/include/apr-1?

creator: MikeDawg@gmail.com
text:
Yes, that file exists and it is readable.  I have since rebuilt apache, and it
compiles fine, with no errors, with no changes to my fs or environment.  I am
also not receiving the initial error that caused me to "upgrade" in the first
place (mod_cgi and apr error #37217).  I'm just having problems with apache
builds being inconsistant (which is a whole new/different matter anyways).

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text:
2.0 releases don't support apr 1.x, only apr 0.9 - upgrade to a httpd 2.1.x beta
if you want to build against apr 1.x.
